pageTitle: Racecard | 18:40 32Red Handicap | Kempton Park | Sky Sports Horse Racing
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {18255=If Hanoverian Baron can reproduce his latest fifth behind Art Scholar in the November Handicap he could be a major factor here as he races off a pound lower mark. Spensley has won four times here, his latest victory coming off a higher mark in September last year. He shouldn't be far away while Be Perfect and Royal Peculiar are eased in grade but the in-form ESTEDAAMA will probably take all the beating again. Marcus Tregoning's filly has been raised 17lb since her winning run began but she still looked to be ahead of the handicapper when breaking her duck on Polytrack at Lingfield last time and can complete the four-timer. Desert Recluse returns from a two-year break and is probably best watched today while Fourth Generation races from out of the handicap., 19680=Be Perfect (USA) 11-1 (8-13) Led after 1f, set steady pace, headed over 4f out, tracked leader, ridden over 2f out, kept on same pace, 6th of 7, 5l behind Moone's My Name (9-7) at Newmarket 1m hcp 105 (2) sft in Oct., 20971=Spensley (IRE) 6-1 (9-12) Held up, ridden and headway 2f out, no impression final furlong, 6th of 12, 1 3/4l behind Henry Clay (9-2) at Wolverhampton 1m 4f hcp 0-85 (4) pol in Oct., 20195=Royal Peculiar 16-1 (9-1) Tracked leaders, ridden over 3f out, weakened over 1f out, 15th of 21, 26l behind Party Line (8-8) at Doncaster 1m 4f hcp 0-100 (2) sft in Oct., 20433=Into Wain (USA) 16-1 (9-9) Mid-division, soon chased leaders, ridden over 1f out, challenged inside final furlong, no extra towards finish, 2nd of 11, 1 3/4l behind The Tiger (9-9) at Catterick 1m 4f hcp 0-85 (4) sft in Oct., 21220=Estedaama (IRE) 5-1 (8-8) In touch, headway on outer over 2f out, soon pressed leader, ridden to lead inside final furlong, ran on, won at Lingfield 1m 4f hcp 0-95 (3) pol in Oct beating Fleeting Image (8-8) by 1 1/2l, 9 ran., 19965=Greylami (IRE) 15-2 (9-8) Mid-division, effort on inner over 2f out, soon no impression, 6th of 8, 12l behind Amoya (8-13) at Ascot 1m 2f hcp 0-90 (3) fm in Jul., 19367=Desert Recluse (IRE) 6-4fav (8-11) Tracked leader, ridden to lead over 2f out, joined inside final 2f, headed 1f out, no extra inside final furlong, 2nd of 5, 1 1/4l behind Mystery Star (10-0) at Wolverhampton 1m 6f hcp 0-95 (3) pol in Oct '10.}

textAfterTable: Non runners 9 (6) 725532 Fourth Generation (IRE) 5 8-10 G A Swinbank R Winston 78 In depth Jump to: Verdict Formwatch Verdict If Hanoverian Baron can reproduce his latest fifth behind Art Scholar in the November Handicap he could be a major factor here as he races off a pound lower mark. Spensley has won four times here, his latest victory coming off a higher mark in September last year. He shouldn't be far away while Be Perfect and Royal Peculiar are eased in grade but the in-form ESTEDAAMA will probably take all the beating again. Marcus Tregoning's filly has been raised 17lb since her winning run began but she still looked to be ahead of the handicapper when breaking her duck on Polytrack at Lingfield last time and can complete the four-timer. Desert Recluse returns from a two-year break and is probably best watched today while Fourth Generation races from out of the handicap. Formwatch Desert Recluse (IRE) 6-4fav
